New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers became the sixth team in NBA history to start a season 13-0.
Cleveland became the first team since the 2015-16 Golden State Warriors to win 13 straight to begin a season.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 11 of his 23 points in the final three minutes of the game.
Mitchell grabbed 13 rebounds and added nine assists.
Darius Garland scored 25 points while Evan Mobley had 14 points with seven rebounds.
Jared McCain had a career-high 34 points for the 76ers.
Kelly Oubre Jr. had 20 points while Caleb Martin added 18 for the Sixers.
Mitchell hit three 3-pointers with less than three minutes to play to extend Cleveland's lead to seven.
Pre-Game Insights: The best news of the day for the Sixers came pre-game when both George and Embiid were cleared to play on Friday night in Orlando.
Head coach Nick Nurse said George’s minutes restriction would be lifted.
Post-Match Reflections: Cavaliers: On a night when Cleveland didn’t come with its best game, the team had enough firepower to hold off a gritty bunch of young Sixers who played perhaps their best all-around game of the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers have won 13 in a row for the fourth time in franchise history. The other three times — in 2009, 2010 and 2017 — were when they had LeBron James on the roster.
